snippet: The former University of Iowa athletics department counselor at the center of a sexual harassment scandal was rehired in 2002 after a national search in which he beat out other candidates because of his strong qualifications.
abstract: University of Iowa oversight chairman William Hines says university did not violate rules when it hired Peter Gray as athletic adviser in 2002; Gray has resigned following report that he violated sexual harassment policy during his earlier employment from 1993 to 1995.
lead_paragraph: The former University of Iowa athletics department counselor at the center of a sexual harassment scandal was rehired in 2002 after a national search in which he beat out other candidates because of his strong qualifications.
